results.title: [Comparative study of atenolol and timolol in the treatment of ocular hypertension].
results.text_hl: [Comparative study of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@ in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@].

citations.NLM: Collignon-Brach J, Weekers R. [Comparative study of atenolol and timolol in the treatment of ocular hypertension]. Bull Soc Belge Ophtalmol. 1978;(180):21-6. PMID: 373834

results.title: Effect of topical atenolol on intraocular pressure.
results.text_hl: Thus topically applied @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ lowers IOP in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@ and may be clinically useful.

citations.NLM: Wettrell K, Pandolfi M. Effect of topical atenolol on intraocular pressure. Br J Ophthalmol. 1977 May;61(5):334-8. PMID: 326301
citations.BibTeX: @article{326301, title={Effect of topical atenolol on intraocular pressure.}, author={Wettrell K and Pandolfi M}, journal={Br J Ophthalmol}, volume={61}, number={5}, pages={334-8}}

results.title: Long-term hypotensive effect of atenolol 4% eyedrops.
results.text_hl: The effect of long-term application of 4% @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ eye drops has been studied in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with either @DISEASE_Glaucoma @DISEASE_MESH:D005901 @@@glaucoma@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Brenkman RF. Long-term hypotensive effect of atenolol 4% eyedrops. Br J Ophthalmol. 1978 May;62(5):287-91. PMID: 656355
citations.BibTeX: @article{656355, title={Long-term hypotensive effect of atenolol 4% eyedrops.}, author={Brenkman RF}, journal={Br J Ophthalmol}, volume={62}, number={5}, pages={287-91}}

results.title: Comparison of ocular hypotensive effects of 3 dosages of oral atenolol.
results.text_hl: Comparison of @DISEASE_Ocular_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D015814 @@@ocular hypotensive@@@ effects of 3 dosages of oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Tutton MK, Smith RJ. Comparison of ocular hypotensive effects of 3 dosages of oral atenolol. Br J Ophthalmol. 1983 Oct;67(10):664-7. PMID: 6351901

results.title: Atenolol versus propranolol. A comparison of ocular hypotensive effect of an oral dose.
results.text_hl: In a controlled double-blind cross-over trial in 10 patients comprising six with @DISEASE_Glaucoma_Open_Angle @DISEASE_MESH:D005902 @@@open-angle glaucoma@@@, three with @DISEASE_Glaucoma_Angle_Closure @DISEASE_MESH:D015812 @@@closed-angle glaucoma@@@, and one with @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@, a single oral dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (50 mg) was significantly more effective than @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (40 mg) in reducing ocular tension.

citations.NLM: Macdonald MJ, Cullen PM, Phillips CI. Atenolol versus propranolol. A comparison of ocular hypotensive effect of an oral dose. Br J Ophthalmol. 1976 Nov;60(11):789-91. PMID: 12782
citations.BibTeX: @article{12782, title={Atenolol versus propranolol. A comparison of ocular hypotensive effect of an oral dose.}, author={Macdonald MJ and Cullen PM and Phillips CI}, journal={Br J Ophthalmol}, volume={60}, number={11}, pages={789-91}}

results.title: Atenolol eye drops in glaucoma: a double-masked, controlled study.
results.text_hl: ...Guttae @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 4% (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@), a pure beta1-blocking (i.e., cardioselective) drug, produced a median overall fall of 5-6 mmHg (range 3-2 to 13-2 mmHg) in the first tonometrised eyes of 7 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Glaucoma_Open_Angle @DISEASE_MESH:D005902 @@@open-angle glaucoma@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@ and 1 with @DISEASE_Glaucoma_Angle_Closure @DISEASE_MESH:D015812 @@@closed-angle glaucoma@@@ (off any treatment for the whole of the day preceding each test day) after allowance for an 'effect' of guttae saline 0-9%, in a double-masked, cross-over trial.

citations.NLM: Phillips CI, Gore SM, Macdonald MJ, Cullen PM. Atenolol eye drops in glaucoma: a double-masked, controlled study. Br J Ophthalmol. 1977 May;61(5):349-53. PMID: 326303
citations.BibTeX: @article{326303, title={Atenolol eye drops in glaucoma: a double-masked, controlled study.}, author={Phillips CI and Gore SM and Macdonald MJ and Cullen PM}, journal={Br J Ophthalmol}, volume={61}, number={5}, pages={349-53}}

results.title: The beta-adrenergic blocking agents and the treatment of glaucoma.
results.text_hl: Autonomic agents used in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Glaucoma @DISEASE_MESH:D005901 @@@glaucoma@@@ include @CHEMICAL_Pilocarpine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010862 @@@pilocarpine@@@, a chilinergic agonist, @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@, an adrenergic agonist, and various beta adrenergic blockers or antagonists including @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Zimmerman TJ, Boger WP 3rd. The beta-adrenergic blocking agents and the treatment of glaucoma. Surv Ophthalmol. 1979 May-Jun;23(6):347-62. PMID: 37605
citations.BibTeX: @article{37605, title={The beta-adrenergic blocking agents and the treatment of glaucoma.}, author={Zimmerman TJ and Boger WP 3rd}, journal={Surv Ophthalmol}, volume={23}, number={6}, pages={347-62}}
